newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dec JGB ends Tokyo at day's high, recovers losses.
newsitem.headline: Dec JGB ends Tokyo at day's high, recovers losses.

text.p: Key December Japanese government bond (JGB) futures ended Tokyo at the day's high on Wednesday, recovering early losses which stemmed partly from corrective selling to their steep advance on Tuesday.
A fall in Tokyo share prices also aided JGBs' recovery.

"After having tested the December's downside in sympathy with U.S. Treasury bonds' tumble overnight, many found that 121.80 was a firm support due to buy-on-dips demand," said a trader at an agricultural bank.
The December contract ended at the day's high of 122.10, after spending most of the day in negative territory.
The 182nd JGB yield rose as high as 2.880 percent compared with its 2.825 percent close on Tuesday.

There were signs that investors who had parked their funds in the money market in the expectation of a credit-tightening had begun to divert that to the long-term debt market after giving up such hopes, a senior money trader said.
The pooled cash is estimated to total four to five trillion yen and bonds are believed to be the main beneficiary of the funds, he said.
"As a result, volatility in the JGBs will increase as the nature of those funds is speculative," said a bank trader.
Traders also said the 161st and 163rd 10-year JGBs, the cheapest JGBs for delivery against the September contract due for delivery on Friday, were still scarce in the market.
The repo rate of the 161st JGBs went above 10 percent at one point this morning.
Cash deliveries for September are scheduled on Friday.

Traders said that some short-position holders are having a hard time rolling over contracts to borrow deliverable bonds beyond half-year corporate book closings on September 30. -- Yoshiko Mori, Tokyo Treasury Desk 813-3432-8676
